quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Bronx and State
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, college, egypt. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In 1643, a Native American uprising killed this unauthorized Puritan preacher of a dissident church discussion group, and pioneer in Rhode Island and the Bronx.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Anne Hutchinson

questions.question: Little Rock is the capital and most populous city of this US state.
Edgar Allen Poe wrote this famous poem in The Bronx in 1846.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Annabel Lee

questions.question: Which US state is nicknamed The Pine Tree State?
The southern region of what US state is known as Little Egypt?
Which one of these statements is true about The Bronx, NY?

options.text: The only borough with a zoo
The only borough  that has no colleges
The only borough that is not an island
The highest  borough above sea level .

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The only borough that is not an island

questions.question: The first college in The Bronx, known as this today, was built in 1884.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fordham University

questions.question: Who was the first European to see The Bronx, NY?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Henry Hudson

questions.question: According to the 2000 Census, what is the approximate population of The Bronx, New York?
What are the colors on the flag of  The Bronx, NY?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blue, White, Orange

questions.question: In 1776, 400 British and Hessian troops land in The Bronx.  A group of 400 American troops held them off while Washington got the main army away safely.  What was this battle called ?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Battle of Pells Point

questions.question: This world famous building opened in The Bronx in 1923.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yankee Stadium

questions.question: What US state borders the states of Virginia, Kentucky, Ohio, Pennsylvania and Maryland?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: West Virginia

questions.question: This oldest house in The Bronx, build in 1748, is New York Citys first house museum, operated since 1897 as a public museum by The National Society of Colonial Dames in the State of New York.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Van Cortlandt House

questions.question: In 1899, this  world famous institution was opened in The Bronx.

options.text: The U.S. Olympic Hall of Fame

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Bronx Zoo

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: State and Country
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, peach, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The capital city of this US state is Trenton, and its largest city is Newark.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New Jersey

questions.question: Which countrys capital city is considered de facto capital of the European Union?
Which EU member is divided into a Greek and a Turkish part?
The flag of what US state features a gold torch and nineteen stars on a blue rectangular field?
Which European Union member is home to Santa Claus?
Which country has the river Danube as most of its northern border?
Which countrys first president was Václav Havel, a writer and dramatist?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Czech Republic

questions.question: Which Nordic country was first to enter the European Union?
The name of which American state means red people in the Choctaw language?
What US state is known as the Peach State?
Which country is known as Österreich in their native language?
Which European Union member has the greatest number of islands?
The name of this US state means flat water and is derived from the name of the Platte River that flows through the state.
What US state is known as The Volunteer State?
Which of the EU founding members is the country of Liberté, Égalité, Fraternité?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Country and Member
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, people, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which EU member state was known to the ancient Greeks and Romans as Dacia?
Which European Union member was the first country to reject communist rule and thus sparkle the liberation of so called Eastern Block?
Which EU member has a significant part of its territory below sea level?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Netherlands

questions.question: Which country has twice rejected European Union membership in national referendums?
In which European Union member the native people make up only 60% of the total population?
Which country is the biggest contributor to the European Union budget?
In May 2004 the European Union accepted 10 new countries. Which of them was first to adopt the Euro as its national currency?
Which country is the youngest independent state to be a member of the European Union? (It has been an independent country only since 1993.)
Which former British colony joined the European Union in 2004?
Where is the European Unions westernmost point not counting overseas territories?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: In Portugals Azores islands

questions.question: Which country is the only member of the European Union that is partly located in Africa?
Which mini country was among the European Union founding members?
This European Union member was once known for huge migration of its people, mainly to the US and UK. Nowadays, however, it attracts many immigrants from new EU members.
Which country associated with banking is not a member of the European Union?
Which EU member was the largest country in Europe in XIV century, but now has land area of just 65 000 sq. km?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Country and State
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, john, candidate. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which member of the European Union completely surrounds two countries that are outside of the club?
All but three European Union official languages are from the Indo-European family. They are Finnish, Estonian and which other language?
Where was the colonial settlement New Amsterdam located?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The state of New York

questions.question: In which country is the European Union’s biggest lake located?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: In Sweden

questions.question: The head of John the Baptist can be seen in the Amiens Cathedral.
Which of these peaks is the highest?

Most of the European Union members are also part of a Schengen Agreement that allows their citizens to travel without passports across the member states. Which EU member is outside of the Schengen group?
Wat Chiang Man is a temple in Thailand. In it, fifteen of these animals represent a sea of unformed matter upon which the cosmos of the Chedi floats.
Which country or state was the first to be attacked in WWII?
Which Muslim country was recognized as a candidate for accession in the EU on December 12th, 1999 at the Helsinki summit of the European Council?
Which EU country or US state is not entirely situated on (an) island(s)?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rhode Island

questions.question: Which of these is the largest in terms of area?
Which of the following metropolitan areas is the largest in terms of population?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New York City

questions.question: The Shaolin temples are perhaps the Buddhist monasteries best known in the West. The word Shaolin means this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Young Forest

questions.question: Which river, flowing entirely through a single country or state, is the longest?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Mediterranean and Island
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, vengaboys, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which one of these Mediterranean islands, belonging to Italy, is the largest in area?
Which of the following flags doesnt include a cross?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the flag of Alaska

questions.question: This island, on which the volcano Etna is situated, is the largest Mediterranean island.
Birmingham is the most populous city of which country or US state?
Complete the lyrics of this 1999 hit single by the Vengaboys, referring to a Spanish island:
Which of these cities was established first?
Which one of these Mediterranean islands is the smallest in area?
Which French Mediterranean island is the birthplace of Napoléon Bonaparte?
On April 11, 2002, Al-Qaeda carried out a terrorist attack near a synagogue on which Tunisian island?
Which of these Mediterranean islands belongs to Croatia and is home of the endangered Griffon Vulture?
What is the location of the worlds largest particle physics laboratory, established in 1954?

options.text: Both have laboratories of equal size.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: In neither of them

questions.question: Which one of these is not a Greek Mediterranean island?
What two colors are featured on the flag and coat of arms of Malta, a country consisting of seven Mediterranean islands?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: White and red

questions.question: Which of the following countries and states shares its name with its capital city?
Which one of these Mediterranean islands does not belong to the group of the Balearic Islands?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Country and North Carolina
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, carolina, policy. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: After World War II, this country was split into two states which were not reunited until 1990.
This military complex in North Carolina is one of the largest in the world and home to the 82 Airborne, the Golden Knights, and U.S. Army Special Operations Command.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fort Bragg

questions.question: What sea captain claimed British possession of the eastern part of Australia in 1770 naming it New South Wales?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Cook

questions.question: Near what sea was the ancient city of Troy located ?
In what South American country was Che Ernesto Guevara born?
North Carolina has been well represented on the American Idol TV series Which contestant from the state became Americas Idol in 2004?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fantasia Barrino

questions.question: What river encountered during the Lewis and Clark expedition (1804-1806) flows directly into the Pacific Ocean between Washington and Oregon?
Which of these rivers runs through the Czech Republic and Germany?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Elbe River

questions.question: In 1838 the Federal Indian Removal Policy was forced into effect by The Treaty of New Echota. Twenty Cherokee Indians, none elected officials of the Cherokee Nation, signed over all Cherokee Territory east of the Mississippi for five million dollars. The Cherokee Indians were then forced to march from their home in the mountain of North Carolina to Okalahoma. This journey became know by what name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Trail of Tears

questions.question: What motto do North Carolina license plates carry?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: First In Flight

questions.question: What country gained independence from the British Mandate for Palestine in 1948?
What city is the capital of Madagascar?
Name the European co-principality whose heads of state are the President of France and the Bishop of Urgel.
Which explorer was the first to reach the South Pole?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roald Amundsen

questions.question: Riga is the capital of which Baltic country?
